lst.name: sentence
lst.str: In an interview with Reuters, Eyskens also said he hoped the cabinet would tomorrow approve the abolition of bourse transaction taxes for non-residents, making Brussels one of the few stock exchanges in the world where foreign investors were not subjected to such a tax.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Eyskens said he hoped later to be able to abolish the transaction taxes for residents as well, but this would depend on progress in cutting the government's high budget deficit.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: But financial analysts said the procedure for recouping the tax is so bureaucratic and slow that it effectively acts as a barrier to foreign investment in Belgium, especially in the secondary bond market.
